revised_title: Distribution, Development, and Substrate Specificity of Spermine Oxidase and Benzylamine Oxidase in Mammalian Blood Plasma
tldr: The authors studied the distribution and development of spermine oxidase and benzylamine oxidase in mammalian blood plasma. They found that spermine oxidase is present in ruminants, while benzylamine oxidase has a wider distribution. The development of these enzymes in newborns is not dependent on rumen development and function. The plasma oxidases differ from intracellular amine oxidase in their substrate specificity.
